content: The Physician Self-Referral Amendments of 1999 Act includes provisions such as eliminating restrictions on physician referrals based on compensation arrangements, exceptions to ownership referral prohibitions, and changes in the definition of group practice. It also delays the implementation of ownership referral changes until final regulations are promulgated and excludes certain medical devices from the referral restrictions. Additionally, it permits pathologists who are independent contractors to supervise clinical laboratory services.
